Events.Text: Hello!
You remember that your friend recommended the Old Town Inn. Tell the assistant you've changed your mind and want to stay at Old Town Inn. [instruction 1 of 5]
Hi, how can I help?
Hello, how can I help?
I'd like to reserve a room at the Old Town Inn.
What days and time please?
What days and time please?
I'd like to stay from May 14th to May 31st.

Actually, you recall that your friend stayed at Old Town Inn in another town. However you've read on a blog that the Hilton Hotel is by long and far the most authentic one. Tell the assistant you've changed your mind and want to stay at Hilton Hotel. [instruction 2 of 5]
What is your name please
May I have your name, please?
Actually, I change my mind, I want to stay at the Hilton Hotel.
Talk to the assistant about this great travel blog that you rely on and that its never let you down on your journeys. Be creative! [instruction 3 of 5]
OK, can I have your name please?
OK, can I have your name please?
I've been following this travel blog that always takes me to the best cities with the most interesting activities. I plan on doing some mountain biking during my current stay!

You just received a text from your partner saying: 'Hey, my brother invited us to his wedding in London on the 31st and I already booked us a flight for the 14th!' Tell the assistant you would like to change your reservation to 11th-27th the following month. [instruction 4 of 5]
That's nice! Can I have your name please?
That's nice! Can I have your name please?
Oh crap! I have a wedding to attend to and I'm going to be out of town most of May! I need to change my reservation June 14th to June 31st.

Tell the assistant you don't really want to go to London because your partner's brother is a bit of a show-off, but obviously you'll be going to the wedding. Finish the booking and bring the conversation to an end. [instruction 5 of 5]
OK, can I have your name please?
OK, can I have your name please?

My name's Alexis. I'm not really excited for this wedding I have to attend in May. My partner's brother is getting married and he's a big show-off so that'll be annoying, but you gotta do what you gotta do.
The hotel is unavailable
I'm very sorry, but there is no room available at the Hilton Hotel for your requested dates.
Hmm, I guess I'll have to figure something else out. Thanks anyway, goodbye!
Thank you
Thank you and goodbye.

Scenario.UserTask: You want to reserve a room at the Shadyside Inn from May 14th to 31st. Your name is Alexis. Please do not make a custom request, and it is ok if no room is available - just say goodbye in this case.
Scenario.WizardTask: Help the user reserve a hotel room. (You can find the video tutorial under https://youtu.be/L7QpscLPTFM, in case you want to watch it again.)

UserQuestionnaire.Question: Did the assistant reserve your hotel?
Did the assistant stay calm and helpful throughout the dialogue?

WizardQuestionnaire.Question: Did the user change his/her mind about what he/she wants at any time?
Did the user become aggressive or annoyed during the dialogue? (Note: some users may be instructed to be annoying.)
Where you unsure about what to do at any time? (Feel free to send us an email with details.)
